meanings.definition: A planned series of future events or performances.
meanings.sent1: The school has exciting programs lined up for the students this year.
meanings.sent2: The television network has a variety of programs for different audiences.
meanings.sent3: The comedy program had everyone laughing so hard they cried.
meanings.sent4: Her life felt like a well-orchestrated program, with each event perfectly timed.
meanings.sent5: Attending the music program made a lasting impression on the audience.

meanings.definition: A set of coded instructions that control the operation of a computer.
meanings.sent1: The software engineer developed a new program to enhance the system's performance.
meanings.sent2: Computer programmers work hard to create efficient programs for various applications.
meanings.sent3: The computer program seemed to have a mind of its own, causing unexpected errors.
meanings.sent4: His coding skills were so advanced, he could make the program dance like a puppet.
meanings.sent5: The antivirus program acted as a shield, protecting the computer from harmful viruses.
